00011 #include "korebot.h"

00013 static char ksock_command_terminator = '\n';
00014 static char * ksock_buf_snd          = NULL;
00015 static unsigned ksock_buf_len        = 0;
00016 
00017 static struct kb_command_s * ksock_cmd_list = NULL;
00018 unsigned                     ksock_cmd_n;
00019 
00020 void DieWithError(char *errorMessage)
00021 {
00022     perror(errorMessage);
00023     exit(1);
00024 }
00025 
00031 int ksock_init(char terminator, unsigned buffer_len)
00032 {
00033   ksock_command_terminator = terminator;
00034   
00035   ksock_cmd_n = 0;
00036 
00037   ksock_cmd_list = KB_ALLOC(struct kb_command_s, 1);
00038   ksock_cmd_list->name     = NULL;
00039   ksock_cmd_list->minParam = 0;
00040   ksock_cmd_list->maxParam = 0;
00041   ksock_cmd_list->parse    = NULL;
00042  
00043   /* Init the command buffer */
00044   ksock_buf_snd = KB_ALLOC(char, buffer_len);
00045   ksock_buf_len = buffer_len;
00046 
00047   return 0;
00048 }

00050 
00054 int ksock_server_open(ksock_t * server, unsigned short port)
00055 {
00056     /* Create socket for incoming connections */
00057     if ((server->serv_socket = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, IPPROTO_TCP)) < 0)
00058         DieWithError("socket() failed");
00059       
00060     /* Construct local address structure */
00061     memset(&(server->serv_addr), 0, sizeof(server->serv_addr)); /* Zero out structure */
00062     server->serv_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;                     /* Internet address family */
00063     server->serv_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);      /* Any incoming interface */
00064     server->serv_addr.sin_port = htons(port);                   /* Local port */
00065 
00066     /* Bind to the local address */
00067     if (bind(server->serv_socket,
00068                 (struct sockaddr *) &(server->serv_addr),sizeof(server->serv_addr)) < 0)
00069         DieWithError("bind() failed");
00070 
00071     /* Mark the socket so it will listen for incoming connections */
00072     if (listen(server->serv_socket, MAXPENDING) < 0)
00073         DieWithError("listen() failed");
00074 
00075     return 0;
00076 }

00078 
00082 int ksock_next_connection(ksock_t * server)
00083 {
00084   struct sockaddr_in echoClntAddr; /* Client address */
00085   unsigned int clntLen;            /* Length of client address data structure */
00086   int clntSock;                    /* Socket descriptor for client */
00087       
00088   /* Set the size of the in-out parameter */
00089   clntLen = sizeof(echoClntAddr);
00090 
00091   /* Wait for a client to connect */
00092   if ((clntSock = accept(server->serv_socket, (struct sockaddr *) &echoClntAddr, &clntLen)) < 0)
00093     DieWithError("accept() failed");
00094 
00095   /* Mark the socket as non blocking */
00096   fcntl(clntSock, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
00097 
00098   /* clntSock is connected to a client! */
00099   kb_warning(KB_WARN_CONNECT, inet_ntoa(echoClntAddr.sin_addr));
00100 
00101   return clntSock;
00102 }
00103 
00113 int ksock_add_command(const char * name, int min_param, 
00114                       int max_param, int (*function)(int argc, char *argv[], void * data))
00115 {
00116   if(!ksock_cmd_list) {
00117     KB_ERROR("ksock_exec_command", KB_ERROR_NOINIT, "kb_socket");
00118     return -KB_ERROR_NOINIT;
00119   }
00120 
00121   /* Store the new command in the list, replacing the last */
00122   ksock_cmd_list[ksock_cmd_n].name = KB_ALLOC(char, strlen(name));
00123   strcpy(ksock_cmd_list[ksock_cmd_n].name, name);
00124   ksock_cmd_list[ksock_cmd_n].minParam = min_param;
00125   ksock_cmd_list[ksock_cmd_n].maxParam = max_param;
00126   ksock_cmd_list[ksock_cmd_n].parse    = function;
00127 
00128   ksock_cmd_n++;
00129 
00130   /* Terminate the list */
00131   ksock_cmd_list = KB_REALLOC(ksock_cmd_list, struct kb_command_s, ksock_cmd_n + 1);
00132   ksock_cmd_list[ksock_cmd_n].name     = NULL;
00133   ksock_cmd_list[ksock_cmd_n].minParam = 0;
00134   ksock_cmd_list[ksock_cmd_n].maxParam = 0;
00135   ksock_cmd_list[ksock_cmd_n].parse    = NULL;
00136 
00137   return 0;
00138 }
00139 
00146 int ksock_remove_command(char * name)
00147 {
00148   int index;
00149 
00150   if(!ksock_cmd_list) {
00151     KB_ERROR("ksock_exec_command", KB_ERROR_NOINIT, "kb_socket");
00152     return -KB_ERROR_NOINIT;
00153   }
00154 
00155   index = kb_find_command(name, ksock_cmd_list);
00156   if(index < 0)
00157     return index;
00158 
00159   for(; index<ksock_cmd_n-1; index++) {
00160     memcpy(&(ksock_cmd_list[index]), &ksock_cmd_list[index+1], sizeof(kb_command_t));
00161   }
00162 
00163   ksock_cmd_list[index].name     = NULL;
00164   ksock_cmd_list[index].minParam = 0;
00165   ksock_cmd_list[index].maxParam = 0;
00166   ksock_cmd_list[index].parse    = NULL;
00167 
00168   return 0;
00169 }
00170 
00171 void list_command()
00172 {
00173   kb_command_t * scan = ksock_cmd_list;
00174   
00175   while(scan->name != NULL) {
00176     printf("%s: %d,%d\r\n", scan->name, scan->minParam, scan->maxParam);
00177     scan++;
00178   }
00179 }
00180 
00186 int ksock_send_command(int socket, char * cmd, ...)
00187 {
00188   va_list ap;
00189   int buflen;
00190   
00191   /* get va_list */
00192   va_start(ap, cmd);
00193   
00194   /* Build the command string */
00195   vsnprintf(ksock_buf_snd, ksock_buf_len-1, cmd, ap);
00196   buflen                  = strlen(ksock_buf_snd);
00197   ksock_buf_snd[buflen]   = ksock_command_terminator;
00198   //ksock_buf_snd[buflen+1] = '\0';
00199   buflen++;
00200   
00201   /* Send the command to the robot */
00202   if (send(socket, ksock_buf_snd, buflen, 0) != buflen)
00203     DieWithError("send() sent a different number of bytes than expected");
00204 
00205   /* end va_list */
00206   va_end(ap);
00207 }
00208 
00216 int ksock_send_answer(int * socketStorage, char * cmd)
00217 {
00218   int buflen;
00219   
00220   /* Add the command terminator */
00221   strncpy(ksock_buf_snd,cmd,ksock_buf_len-1);
00222   buflen                  = strlen(ksock_buf_snd);
00223   ksock_buf_snd[buflen]   = ksock_command_terminator;
00224   buflen++;
00225   
00226   /* Send the command to the robot */
00227   if (send(*socketStorage, ksock_buf_snd, buflen, 0) != buflen)
00228     DieWithError("send() sent a different number of bytes than expected");
00229 
00230   kb_free(socketStorage);
00231 }

00260 int ksock_exec_command_pending(int clntSock, char * cmd)
00261 {
00262   int * socketStorage;
00263 
00264   if(!ksock_cmd_list) {
00265     KB_ERROR("ksock_exec_command", KB_ERROR_NOINIT, "kb_socket");
00266     return -KB_ERROR_NOINIT;
00267   }
00268 
00269   socketStorage  = KB_ALLOC(int,1);
00270   *socketStorage = clntSock;
00271   
00272   return kb_parse_command( cmd, ksock_cmd_list,(void*)socketStorage);
00273 }
00274 
00285 int ksock_exec_command(char * cmd)
00286 {
00287   if(!ksock_cmd_list) {
00288     KB_ERROR("ksock_exec_command", KB_ERROR_NOINIT, "kb_socket");
00289     return -KB_ERROR_NOINIT;
00290   }
00291     
00292   return kb_parse_command( cmd, ksock_cmd_list,NULL);
00293 }
00294 
00308 int ksock_get_command(int clntSocket, char * cmdBuffer, unsigned bufSize)
00309 {
00310   int recvMsgSize;
00311   char * term;
00312   unsigned cmdLen;
00313 
00314   /* Receive available data from client */
00315   if ((recvMsgSize = recv(clntSocket, cmdBuffer, bufSize-1, MSG_PEEK)) < 0)
00316   {
00317     if(errno == EAGAIN) {
00318       cmdBuffer[0] = '\0';
00319       return 0;
00320     } 
00321     else
00322       DieWithError("recv() failed");
00323   }
00324 
00325   /* check if something was available */
00326   if(!recvMsgSize) {
00327     cmdBuffer[0] = '\0';
00328     return -3;
00329   }
00330 
00331   /* Terminate the string */
00332   cmdBuffer[recvMsgSize] = '\0';
00333 
00334   /* Check if a full command is received */
00335   term = strchr(cmdBuffer, ksock_command_terminator);
00336   if( term == NULL) {
00337     cmdBuffer[0] = '\0';
00338     return -1;
00339   }
00340 
00341   /* Get the length of the full command */
00342   *term  = '\0';
00343   cmdLen = strlen(cmdBuffer) + 1;
00344 
00345   /* Remove the full command from the socket */
00346   if ((recvMsgSize = recv(clntSocket, cmdBuffer, cmdLen, 0)) < 0)
00347     DieWithError("recv() failed");
00348   /* Coherency Test */
00349   if(recvMsgSize != cmdLen) {
00350     cmdBuffer[0] = '\0';
00351     return -2;
00352   }
00353 
00354   /* Terminate the string, replacing the command terminator */
00355   cmdBuffer[recvMsgSize - 1] = '\0';
00356 
00357   /* return the comamnd length */
00358   return recvMsgSize;
00359 }
00360 
00370 int ksock_connect(char * servIP, unsigned short servPort)
00371 {
00372   struct sockaddr_in servAddr; /* Echo server address */
00373   int sock;
00374 
00375   /* Create a reliable, stream socket using TCP */
00376   if ((sock = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, IPPROTO_TCP)) < 0)
00377     DieWithError("socket() failed");
00378 
00379   /* Construct the server address structure */
00380   memset(&servAddr, 0, sizeof(servAddr));         /* Zero out structure */
00381   servAddr.sin_family      = AF_INET;             /* Internet address family */
00382   servAddr.sin_addr.s_addr = inet_addr(servIP);   /* Server IP address */
00383   servAddr.sin_port        = htons(servPort);     /* Server port */
00384 
00385   /* Establish the connection to the echo server */
00386   if (connect(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &servAddr, sizeof(servAddr)) < 0)
00387     DieWithError("connect() failed");
00388 
00389   return sock;
00390 }
